document.docAuthor: Dias, Fernando Maia Silva, Dolibaina, Diego Rodrigo, Mielke, Olaf Hermann Hendrik & Casagrande, Mirna Martins
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Stichelia Zikán (Riodinidae: Riodininae: Symmachiini), with the description of a new species from southern Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Stichelia Zikán (Riodinidae: Riodininae: Symmachiini), with the description of a new species from southern Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Charis dukinfieldia Schaus, 1902
. p. 401 .—Godman 1903 . p. 539 , fig. 3 .—Mengel 1905 . p. 65 .

Phaenochitonia dukinfieldia
; Stichel 1910 . p. 15 .—Stichel 1911 . p. 241 . —Stichel 1930 . p. 519 .

Phaenochitonia dukinfildia
[ sic ]; Seitz 1916 . p. 677 , pl. 134 -i, misspelling.

Stichelia dukinfieldia
; Zikán 1949 . p. 539 .—D’Abrera 1994 . p. 1049 .—Mielke 1995 . p. 767 .—Hall & Willmott 1996 . p. 649 .— Hall & Harvey 2002 . p. 189 .—Callaghan & Lamas 2004 . p. 165 .—Dolibaina, Mielke & Casagrande 2011 . p. 348 .— Casagrande, Dolibaina, Carneiro, Dias, Leite & Mielke [ 2012 ]. pp. 300, 307 , figs. 201–204 .

Diagnosis. Forewing length, male: 10–11mm ; female: 11–12mm (n= 10 ) (
Figs 7 –10
, 25 ). Easily distinguished from other species of the genus by the presence of two orange bands on the forewing: a proximal band, from costal margin to the end of discal cell; and a distal band, extending diagonally from the costal margin to the outer margin close to the tornus.
Stichelia dukinfieldia
presents an additional orange band on the hindwing. Male genitalia (
Figs 33–34
) with the ventral projection of the tegumen and the dorsal projection of the saccus slightly curved, uncus rectangular and angular in lateral view; projections of the gnathos closer to each other than other species of the “
bocchoris
” species group; pedicel thin in ventral view; aedeagus slender than other species of the genus; anterior projection of the saccus bilobed as in
S. bocchoris
; ventral lobe of the valve of about the same size as the dorsal lobe. Female genitalia (
Figs 42–44
) with lamella postvaginalis arched as in
S. bocchoris
; ductus bursae straight, but slightly curved before the corpus bursae; signa absent (n = 3 ).

Taxonomic comments. Schaus ( 1902 ) described this species based in an unknown number of specimens from Castro, Paraná, Brazil , although he provides a voucher number for the type , No. 5904 (USNM). However, there are four additional specimens, three males and one female, from the same locality and with the same voucher number, and a female specimen with the same voucher number, but from an unknown locality in the state of São Paulo, Brazil deposited at the USNM. To avoid future confusion and assure the stability of the type location (ICZN 1999 ), a male specimen from Castro, illustrated by Warren et. al. ( 2013 ) and deposited in the type collection of the USNM, is here designed lectotype , and the three remaining specimens from Castro are designed paralectotypes . The female specimen from São Paulo is not considered to be part of the type series: it is not cited by Schaus ( 1902 ) in the original description, even though it bears the same voucher number and probably was used to describe the species. Apparently this species closest ally is
S. bocchoris
, as
S. dukinfieldia
also have orange scales on the pleura of the last abdominal segments; male genitalia with the anterior projection of the saccus slightly bilobed, and female genitalia with lamella post-vaginal arched.

Distribution. Occurs exclusively in open environments in the states of Bahia to Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil , at elevations above 800m (
Fig. 51
). As
S. bocchoris
, most individuals ( circa 93 %) were recorded between December and March (n = 80 ).

Type material.
The lectotype of
Charis dukinfieldia Schaus, 1902
, here designated, has the following labels: / Castro, Parana[, Brazil ]/ Collection W. Schaus/
Charis dukinfieldia
type Schaus/ Type No. 5904 U.S. N.M./ LECTOTYPE
Charis dukinfieldia Schaus, 1902
, Dias, Dolibaina, Casagrande & Mielke det. 2013 / LECTOTYPUS / (deposited at USNM). The characteristic lectotype label will be sent to the curator of the collection.

Examined material. BRAZIL , Bahia,
